summary: The document is a confidential communication from the Chief of the East Asia Division to the Chief of Base and Chief of Station in Canberra, concerning a request by Australian Justice A. R. Moffitt for information on Mr. Herbert Itkin's reliability and his affiliations with the CIA and FBI from 1964 to 1969. Moffitt is investigating organized crime infiltration in New South Wales and sought evidence from Itkin's testimony in a UK court case. The CIA's Office of General Counsel provided Moffitt with three affidavits clarifying Itkin's CIA affiliation, stating he was not sent to England by the CIA nor did he provide information to the CIA while there.
key_findings: Justice Moffitt requested information on Herbert Itkin's reliability and his past employment with the CIA and FBI.
Itkin claimed to have been recruited by the CIA in an undercover capacity around 1955 and worked for both the FBI and CIA until January 1968.
The CIA provided Moffitt with three affidavits regarding Itkin's affiliation, stating he was not sent to England by the CIA nor did he provide information to the CIA while in England.
The communication underscores the sensitivity and confidentiality of the information shared, with strict instructions on reproduction and handling.
